h6901.definition: a primitive root; to admit, i.e. take (literally or figuratively); choose, (take) hold, receive, (under-) take.

h6902.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6901}}; to acquire; receive, take.

h6903.definition: (Aramaic) or קֳבֵל; (Aramaic), (corresponding to {{h6905}}; (adverbially) in front of; usually (with other particles) on account of, so as, since, hence; according to,   as,   because, before,   for this cause,   forasmuch as,   by this means, over against, by reason of,   that,   therefore,   though,   wherefore.

h6904.definition: from {{h6901}} in the sense of confronting (as standing opposite in order to receive); a battering-ram; war.

h6905.definition: from {{h6901}} in the sense of opposite (see {{h6904}}); the presence, i.e. (adverbially) in front of; before.

h6906.definition: a primitive root; to cover, i.e. (figuratively) defraud; rob, spoil.

h6907.definition: from {{h6906}}; a goblet (as deep like a cover); dregs.

h6908.definition: a primitive root; to grasp, i.e. collect; assemble (selves), gather (bring) (together, selves together, up), heap, resort, × surely, take up.

h6909.definition: from {{h6908}} and {{h410}}; God has gathered; Kabtseel, a place in Palestine; Kabzeel. Compare {{h3343}}.

h6910.definition: feminine passive participle of {{h6908}}; a hoard; × gather.

h6911.definition: dual from {{h6908}}; a double heap; Kibtsajim, a place in Palestine; Kibzaim.

h6912.definition: a primitive root; to inter; × in any wise, bury(-ier).

h6913.definition: or (feminine) קִבְרָה; from {{h6912}}; a sepulchre; burying place, grave, sepulchre.

h6914.definition: from the feminine plural of {{h6913}} and {{h8378}} with the article interposed; graves of the longing; Kibroth-hat-Taavh, a place in the Desert; Kibroth-hattaavah.

h6915.definition: a primitive root; to shrivel up, i.e. contract or bend the body (or neck) in deference; bow (down) (the) head, stoop.

h6916.definition: from {{h6915}}; cassia bark (as in shrivelled rolls); cassia.

h6917.definition: passive participle of {{h6923}}; a pristine hero; ancient.

h6918.definition: or קָדֹשׁ; from {{h6942}}; sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary; holy (One), saint.

h6919.definition: a primitive root to inflame; to inflame; burn, kindle.

h6920.definition: from {{h6919}}; inflammation, i.e. febrile disease; burning ague, fever.

h6921.definition: or קָדִם; from {{h6923}}; the fore or front part; hence (by orientation) the East (often adverbially, eastward, for brevity the east wind); east(-ward, wind).

h6923.definition: a primitive root; to project (one self), i.e. precede; hence, to anticipate, hasten, meet (usually for help); come (go, (flee)) before,   disappoint, meet, prevent.

h6924.definition: or קֵדְמָה; from {{h6923}}; the front, of place (absolutely, the fore part, relatively the East) or time (antiquity); often used adverbially (before, anciently, eastward); aforetime, ancient (time), before, east (end, part, side, -ward), eternal, × ever(-lasting), forward, old, past. Compare {{h6926}}.

h6925.definition: (Aramaic) or קְדָם; (Aramaic) (Daniel 7:13), corresponding to {{h6924}}; before; before, × from, × I (thought), × me,   of, × it pleased, presence.

h6926.definition: feminine of {{h6924}}; the forward part (or relatively) East (often adverbially, on the east or in front); east(-ward).

h6927.definition: from {{h6923}}; priority (in time); also used adverbially (before); afore, antiquity, former (old) estate.

h6928.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6927}}; former time; afore(-time), ago.

h6929.definition: from {{h6923}}; precedence; Kedemah, a son of Ishmael; Kedemah.

h6931.definition: or קַדְמֹנִי; from {{h6930}}; (of time) anterior or (of place) oriental; ancient, they that went before, east, (thing of) old.

h6932.definition: from {{h6923}}; beginnings; Kedemoth, a place in eastern Palestine; Kedemoth.

h6933.definition: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h6923}}; first; first.

h6934.definition: from {{h6924}} and {{h410}}; presence of God; Kadmiel, the name of three Israelites; Kadmiel.

h6935.definition: the same as {{h6931}}; ancient, i.e. aboriginal; Kadmonite (collectively), the name of a tribe in Palestine; Kadmonites.

h6936.definition: from {{h6915}}; the crown of the head (as the part most bowed); crown (of the head), pate, scalp, top of the head.

h6937.definition: a primitive root; to be ashy, i.e. dark-colored; by implication, to mourn (in sackcloth or sordid garments); be black(-ish), be (make) dark(-en), × heavily, (cause to) mourn.

h6938.definition: from {{h6937}}; dusky (of the skin or the tent); Kedar, a son of Ishmael; also (collectively) Bedouin (as his descendants or representatives); Kedar.

h6939.definition: from {{h6937}}; dusky place; Kidron, a brook near Jerusalem; Kidron.

h6941.definition: adverb from {{h6937}}; blackish ones (i.e. in sackcloth); used adverbially, in mourning weeds; mournfully.

h6942.definition: a primitive root; to be (causatively, make, pronounce or observe as) clean (ceremonially or morally); appoint, bid, consecrate, dedicate, defile, hallow, (be, keep) holy(-er, place), keep, prepare, proclaim, purify, sanctify(-ied one, self), × wholly.

h6943.definition: from {{h6942}}; a sanctum; Kedesh, the name of four places in Palestine; Kedesh.

h6944.definition: from {{h6942}}; a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity; consecrated (thing), dedicated (thing), hallowed (thing), holiness, (× most) holy (× day, portion, thing), saint, sanctuary.

h6945.definition: from {{h6942}}; a (quasi) sacred person, i.e. (technically) a (male) devotee (by prostitution) to licentious idolatry; sodomite, unclean.

h6946.definition: the same as {{h6945}}; sanctuary; Kadesh, a place in the Desert; Kadesh. Compare {{h6947}}.

h6947.definition: from the same as {{h6946}} and an otherwise unused word (apparently compounded of a correspondent to {{h1251}} and a derivative of {{h5128}}) meaning desert of a fugitive; Kadesh of (the) Wilderness of Wandering; Kadesh-Barnea, a place in the Desert; Kadeshbarnea.

h6948.definition: feminine of {{h6945}}; a female devotee (i.e. prostitute); harlot, whore.

h6949.definition: a primitive root; to be dull; be set on edge, be blunt.

h6950.definition: a primitive root; to convoke; assemble (selves) (together), gather (selves) (together).

h6951.definition: from {{h6950}}; assemblage (usually concretely); assembly, company, congregation, multitude.

h6953.definition: feminine of active participle from {{h6950}}; a (female) assembler (i.e. lecturer); abstractly, preaching (used as a 'nom de plume', Koheleth); preacher.

h6954.definition: from {{h6950}}; convocation; Kehelathah, a place in the Desert; Kehelathah.

h6955.definition: from an unused root meaning to ally oneself; allied; Kehath, an Israelite; Kohath.

h6956.definition: patronymically from {{h6955}}; a Kohathite (collectively) or descendants of Kehath; Kohathites.

h6957.definition: or קָו; from {{h6960}} (compare {{h6961}}); a cord (as connecting), especially for measuring; figuratively, a rule; also a rim, a musical string or accord; line. Compare {{h6978}}.

h6958.definition: or קָיָה; (Jeremiah 25:27), a primitive root; to vomit; spue (out), vomit (out, up, up again).

h6959.definition: a form collateral to {{h3553}}; a helmet; helmet.

h6960.definition: a primitive root; to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect; gather (together), look, patiently, tarry, wait (for, on, upon).

h6961.definition: from {{h6960}}; a (measuring) cord (as if for binding); line.

h6962.definition: a primitive root; properly, to cut off, i.e. (figuratively) detest; begrieved, loathe self.

h6963.definition: or קֹל; from an unused root meaning to call aloud; a voice or sound; aloud, bleating, crackling, cry (  out), fame, lightness, lowing, noise,   hold peace, (pro-) claim, proclamation,   sing, sound,   spark, thunder(-ing), voice,   yell.

h6964.definition: from {{h6963}} and {{h3050}}; voice of Jah; Kolajah, the name of two Israelites; Kolaiah.

h6965.definition: a primitive root; to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative); abide, accomplish, × be clearer, confirm, continue, decree, × be dim, endure, × enemy, enjoin, get up, make good, help, hold, (help to) lift up (again), make, × but newly, ordain, perform, pitch, raise (up), rear (up), remain, (a-) rise (up) (again, against), rouse up, set (up), (e-) stablish, (make to) stand (up), stir up, strengthen, succeed, (as-, make) sure(-ly), (be) up(-hold, -rising).

h6966.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6965}}; appoint, establish, make, raise up self, (a-) rise (up), (make to) stand, set (up).

h6967.definition: from {{h6965}}; height; × along, height, high, stature, tall.

h6969.definition: a primitive root; to strike a musical note, i.e. chant or wail (at a funeral); lament, mourning woman.

h6970.definition: probably from {{h6972}} in the original sense of cutting off; curtailment; Koa, a region of Babylon; Koa.

h6971.definition: or קֹף; of foreign origin,; a monkey; ape.

h6972.definition: a primitive root; to clip off; used only as denominative from {{h7019}}; to spend the harvest season; summer.

h6973.definition: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of severing oneself from (compare {{h6962}})); to be (causatively, make) disgusted or anxious; abhor, be distressed, be grieved, loathe, vex, be weary.

h6974.definition: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of abruptness in starting up from sleep (compare {{h3364}})); to awake (literally or figuratively); arise, (be) (a-) wake, watch.

h6975.definition: or קֹץ; from {{h6972}} (in the sense of pricking); a thorn; thorn.

h6976.definition: the same as {{h6975}}; Kots, the name of two Israelites; Koz, Hakkoz (including the article).

h6977.definition: feminine passive participle of {{h6972}} in its original sense; a forelock (as shorn); lock.

h6978.definition: from {{h6957}} (in the sense of a fastening); stalwart; × meted out.

h6979.definition: a primitive root; also denominative from {{h7023}}; to trench; by implication, to throw forth; to wall up, whether literal (to build a wall) or figurative (to estop); break down, cast out, destroy, dig.

h6980.definition: from {{h6979}}; (only plural) trenches, i.e. a web (as if so formed); web.

h6981.definition: or קֹרֵא; (1 Chronicles 26:1), active participle of {{h7121}}; crier; Kore, the name of two Israelites; Kore.

h6982.definition: or קֹרָה; from {{h6979}}; a rafter (forming trenches as it were); by implication, a roof; beam, roof.

h6983.definition: a primitive root; to bend; used only as denominative for {{h3369}},; to set a trap; lay a snare.

h6984.definition: from the passive participle of {{h6983}} and {{h3050}}; entrapped of Jah; Kushajah, an Israelite; Kushaiah.

h6985.definition: from {{h6990}} in the sense of abbreviation; a little, i.e. (adverbially) merely; very.

h6986.definition: from an unused root meaning to cut off; ruin; destroying, destruction.

h6987.definition: from the same as {{h6986}}; extermination; destruction.

h6989.definition: feminine passive participle of {{h6999}}; perfumed; Keturah, a wife of Abraham; Keturah.

h6990.definition: a primitive root; to clip off, i.e. (figuratively) destroy; be cut off.

h6991.definition: a primitive root; properly, to cut off, i.e. (figuratively) put to death; kill, slay.

h6994.definition: a primitive root (rather denominative from {{h6996}}); to diminish, i.e. be (causatively, make) diminutive or (figuratively) of no account; be a (make) small (thing), be not worthy.

h6995.definition: from {{h6994}}; a pettiness, i.e. the little finger; little finger.

h6996.definition: or קָטֹן; from {{h6962}}; abbreviated, i.e. diminutive, literally (in quantity, size or number) or figuratively (in age or importance); least, less(-er), little (one), small(-est, one, quantity, thing), young(-er, -est).

h6997.definition: the same as {{h6996}}; small; Katan, an Israelite; Hakkatan (including the article).

h6998.definition: a primitive root; to strip off; crop off, cut down (up), pluck.

h6999.definition: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of fumigation in a close place and perhaps thus driving out the occupants); to smoke, i.e. turn into fragrance by fire (especially as an act of worship); burn (incense, sacrifice) (upon), (altar for) incense, kindle, offer (incense, a sacrifice).

h7000.definition: a primitive root; to inclose; join.
